headline: Mehmet Oz visits Cumberland County, talks Trump endorsement
author: George Stockburger
sentences:
Oz described the endorsement as “massive for our campaign” and that “people call you back, things get scheduled quicker.”
Get the latest news on Pennsylvania Politics and the 2022 Election from Your Local Election Headquarters.
“It allows me to engage people who are appropriately skeptical but now overwhelmingly understanding I am the best candidate to win the primary on the Republican side on May 17,” expressed Oz.
The former television personality stopped by the West Shore Farmer’s Market and The Pizza Grille alongside State Senator Mike Regan, who endorsed Oz earlier in the primary season.
An April WHTM/Emerson College Polling/The Hill poll of 1,000 likely Pennsylvania Republican voters found McCormick leading Oz 17.8% to 16.6%.

“So you control your destiny and mine.”
Stay up to date on the latest from abc27 News on-air and on the go with the free abc27 Mobile app.
Both Oz and McCormick will be on the debate stage at the abc27 studio on April 25 alongside Kathy Barnette, Jeff Bartos, and Carla Sands.
Trump’s endorsement surprised many conservatives, some of whom have endorsed Oz’s chief competitor Dave McCormick.
(WHTM) – Pennsylvania Republican Senate Candidate Dr. Mehmet Oz visited Cumberland County on Friday.
The exclusive one hour debate will air across the commonwealth at 8 p.m. and stream on abc27.com.
Oz’s visit to the Midstate comes shortly after he was endorsed by former President Donald Trump.
Oz is one of seven Republicans in the race to replace Pat Toomey in the United States Senate.
George Bochetto and Sean Gale each received less than 4% and 32.5% of voters were undecided.
Barnette finished third with 10.2%, Bartos received 8.9%, and Sands received 7.7%.

“The only way I lose is if people don’t vote,” said Oz.
